summary: This bill, the "No Tax Breaks for Outsourcing Act," amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to address several international tax issues. Key provisions include measures related to current year inclusion of net CFC tested income, country-by-country application of foreign tax credit limitations, limitations on interest deductions for multinational corporations, and modifications to rules concerning inverted corporations. The bill also includes changes related to foreign tax credits and the treatment of foreign corporations managed and controlled in the U.S.
